en.intro_text:
You can use this editor to create or modify ShortEvents.

While this greatly simplifies the process, you should still reference the Official Documentation for more information on each field. Our Discord is a good place to find extra help. If you have the dev role, feel free to ask for help in dev channels if you find you need it.

To edit an existing event, use the upper tab buttons to navigate to the file you'd like to edit. Once a type and biome is selected, all the current events will be displayed as their event_ids. Select one to begin editing it.

If you'd like to create a new event, you can use the lower tab to start the process. Fill in all necessary fields (required fields will be marked by a *) and then save the event to add it to the game's files. Any dropdowns or multi-selects should provide all available options. But, please don't rely on this editor to inform you of all intricacies! Once again, the Official Documentation should be referenced while writing.

If you would like to make bulk changes to multiple events at a time, this tool will not be helpful!
en.empty_event_list: There's no events for this type and biome.
en.empty_event_id: be sure to add an id!
en.location_info: location: Click to add or remove a place as a possible location. You only need to include the biome name if any camp is applicable.
en.season_info: season: Click to add or remove a required season.
en.subtype_info: subtypes: Click to add or remove a subtype.
en.acc_info: new_accessory: Not accessible without 'accessory' subtype. Click to add or remove. Adding a category name will allow the event to give any accessory in that category.
en.m_c_info: The following information will dictate who the main cat (m_c) affected by the event can be. You should use m_c as the designator for the main cat's name and pronouns in the event text.
en.mass_death_info: The 'mass_death' subtype was selected, so the following information will dictate which cats in the clan can be affected by the event. You can use multi_cat in the event text to create a list of the affected cat names. You cannot choose a specific cat to use pronoun tags for, so they/them should be used to refer to the group as a whole.
en.death_info: The event will kill this cat.
en.rank_info: rank: Click to add or remove an allowed rank.
en.age_info: age: Click to add or remove an allowed age.
en.skill_info: skill: Click a path, then select a level to add or remove the skill. The chosen level includes that level and any higher levels. Levels are listed from lowest to highest. Exclusions will override allowances.
en.trait_info: trait: Click to add or remove a trait.
en.classic: Is this limited to classic mode?
en.cruel_season: Is this limited to cruel season?
en.no_body: Is the dead cat's body irretrievable?
en.clan_wide: Should all involved cat buttons be hidden?
en.romance: Can m_c and r_c be romantic?
en.all_lives: Would a leader lose all lives?
en.some_lives: Would a leader lose multiple lives, but not all?
en.lives_remain: Should this only happen when a leader has multiple lives left?
en.high_lives: Should this only happen when the leader has 7-9 lives?
en.mid_lives: Should this only happen when the leader has 4-6 lives?
en.low_lives: Should this only happen when the leader has 1-3 lives?
en.rank_tags: In addition to the involved cats, Clan must have at least ...
en.not_mates: m_c and r_c are NOT mates (do not use this tag for pairings that are already prohibited, such as siblings)
en.parent/child: m_c is the parent of r_c
en.child/parent: m_c is the child of r_c
en.app/mentor: m_c is the apprentice of r_c
en.mentor/app: m_c is the mentor of r_c
